data.title: Tanks should not go close to targeted buildings
data.body:
When a tank attacks a unit, it will go close to its target, instead of staying at maximum range. This is so that if the target runs away, the tank can still hit. But if you are attacking a building, it doesn't make sense to get close, because the building does not move. I think that tanks should not go close to buildings, and should instead stay at maximum range. 

This has a particular impact right now in D2K because the siege tank has +1 range than the missile tower, so it is supposed to defeat that building by staying out of. Instead, the siege tank goes close to the missile tower and enters its range, getting destroyed. It would be best if it didn't do this.

-> This behavior of tanks going close to their target occurs when the tank uses AttackTurreted, but not AttackFrontal.

data.title: Replace ColorRamp with HSLColor everywhere.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Fixes:
- Nuclear-purple color exploit.
- #3247.
- Removes a bunch of unnecessary color conversions every frame.

Caveats:
- The ramp range is now defined on the palette, so ramps can no longer be set per-player (may impact maps which define custom colors).
- It's no longer possible to perfectly recreate the original WW color ramps (I doubt we care).
- The old ColorRamp setting isn't migrated, so players will lose their color settings.

data.title: Improvements to player drop behavior

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Players and bots now surrender when the controlling client disconnects. This may reduce the occurence of #3228, but probably doesn't fix it (we don't have a repro case).

Server tweaks:
- Prevent crash when a client drops (#3224).
- Server messages now show up as "Server" in the chat dialog.
- The oldest player in a dedicated server is promoted to admin when the old admin drops.

data.title: basewalking options and where is volkov on the playtest version ?
data.body:
hi all,

After a good discussion on the IRC chat, 
i suggest to developpe a game option about the base walking.

today, an ally base walking against an soviets defense base is impossible to play :

artillery is the best long range shooter (better than tesla or v2 or other ...)
soviet mine doesn't destroy vehicule (and so doesnt stop the base walking without many damage)

OpenRA is an strategic game and base walking isn't a strategic attack ! (this is only my own opinion)
i think its awful to cross all the map with  power plant and AA gun and artillery.

i suggest :

testla (or other soviet defense like V2) has the same long-range shoot than artillery
or / and soviet mine can destroy vehicule 
or / and a limit (by circle size) of builing around a vcm 
or / and a limit of power by vcm (but it will be change with an another inexpensive building like airfield ...)
or / and a solution with speed building power plant with engineers (more engineer, more power plant building speed)

the debate is open !

i have an another question :
where is volkov on the new version ? it 's very pity to cant find it.

i know that is a question of permission but is it possible to create an "open" volkov with "open" icon and voice ?

very great job for this game and the new playtest version with  this new options !

very sorry for my poor english

Guibsou

data.title: Group pathing
data.body:
Transferred from the wiki.

> Our current pathfinding solution is inadequate  we do massive amounts of redundant work, our formations are messy and string out even when adequate space is available, and we block on things that are going to move out of the way.

This is @chrisforbes new plan, for handling a Move order  processed on the issuing client at UOG level (so the entire selection is available):

> - Split selection into subgroups based on UMT, other caps, isolation. All units within a subgroup should be capable of following the same path, (whether they actually DO or not is irrelevant)
> - For each subgroup, use connected-components to select a suitable actual destination point, and a source reference point relative to the subgroups current location.
>   For each unit within the subgroup, translate the relative displacement from the groups reference point to the groups destination. If this point is unreachable, replace it via connected-components with a suitable point that is reachable.
> - For each unit, label it with a tag for its subgroup.
> - For each unit, compute a path to its personal destination point, ignoring for pathing purposes all units which have the same tag.
> - On colliding with another unit, if it has the same tag, WAIT [up to some timeout, to eliminate the possibility of perpetual jams]. If the tag differs, REPATH.

data.title: Fixed a desync when the bot controlling client left a dedicated server
data.body:
See #3228

While I drop all bots in the lobby when the admin leaves for #2957 I did not think about the problems it could cause in-game when the bot controller leaves the game.

data.title: Refactor map loading
data.body:
Our map loading (among other things) is a huge mess.

Some of the specific failures that I'd like to see fixed are:
- All maps are fully(?) initialized during loading, which contributes to the excessive load times.
- Lobby faction choices derive from the shellmap.
- Map previews aren't atlased, causing excessive batches in the map chooser.

I have the following changes in mind:
- Bump the map format version, and require maps to include a pre-rendered preview bitmap. Custom maps can ship a modified bitmap (e.g. the singleplayer missions can have a faction icon). Older maps will have their previews generated synchronously during game load (may regress load times for users with many custom maps). The bitmaps can also be used by other services, like the content website and quicklook on OSX.
- Add a MapMetadata object which encodes the information (including faction choices) displayed in the map chooser and lobby.
- Add a new MapLoader object on ModData for managing map metadata and atlasing previews into a sheet for rendering.
- Avoid parsing the full map until it is actually needed to play a game.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/320647-refactor-map-loading?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: bogus yaml removal: -AttackFrontal:
data.body:
I want to do -AttackFrontal for a unit, but it won't let me start the program. If I leave AttackFrontal and try to add AttackTurreted, the game crashes when I build the unit. 

Same thing happened for -Bib: .

Why aren't all yaml removals allowed?

data.title: D2K balance
data.body:
some important balance changes.

There is a problem with stalemates and overpowered turrets. Hopefully an increase in the power of artillery will solve this. A few other adjustments were made to artillery.
